comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: Madman's Window? That's such a cool name!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: " About a mile from Glenarm on the Coast Road to Ballygally, is a large rock with an opening at the top, referred to as the madman's window. The name goes back nearly two centuries to the time when a young girl was drowned in Glenarm Bay. Her sweetheart was so deeply moved by her death that he lost his sanity and each day he would sit at the rock, gazing at the window waiting for his girlfriend to return. " www.causewaycoastandglens.com/portals/2/myth/book6.aspx In the 1940s [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nigel_kelso/527515210/] In 1990 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nigel_kelso/527515206/] In 2007 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johns_pix/822575917/]
